intro: Blepharis obmitrata, commonly known as the narrowleaf wireweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to survive in dry, hot environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple and bloom during the spring and early summer. The plant is often found in disturbed areas and can spread rapidly under favorable conditions.
